import { OtpViewImage } from "/src/components/Images";


# OTP View
OTP Views allow user to input OTP code.

<div style={{backgroundColor: 'white',border: '1px solid #F4F6F8', borderRadius: 16, padding: 32, marginBottom: 24}}>
   <OtpViewImage />
</div>

```xml
<com.waresix.lib.ui.component.atom.OtpAV
	android:id="@+id/otp"
	android:layout_width="wrap_content"
	android:layout_height="wrap_content"
	android:background="@null"
	android:minHeight="0dp"
	android:maxLines="1"
	android:cursorVisible="true"
	android:inputType="number"
	android:textAllCaps="true"
	android:textColor="#000000"
	app:hideLineWhenFilled="false"
	app:itemSpacing="16dp" />
```

```kotlin
otp.setOtpCompletionListener(object: onOtpCompletionListener {
	override fun onOtpCompleted(otp: String) {
		// do something on finish input OTP Code
	}
})
otp.doAfterTextChanged {
	// do something while input the OTP Code
}
```

After you wrote the code above, your OTP component might not working as you expected. When you click the component, softkeyboard won't come up and you cannot input
the otp code. Don't worry, we just need to setup the theme for our OTP component.

## Setup on Activity or Fragment
Head to `res/values/styles.xml`, then add the following line to your applied appTheme.
```xml
<item name="otpViewStyle">@style/OtpWidget.OtpView</item>
```
Here's the example for `styles.xml`
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<resources>

    <!-- Base application theme. -->
    <style name="AppTheme" parent="Theme.MaterialComponents.Light.NoActionBar">
        <!-- Customize your theme here. -->
        <item name="otpViewStyle">@style/OtpWidget.OtpView</item>
    </style>

</resources>
```

<br/><br/>

## Setup on a Sheet
To apply otp view on a Sheet, we need to pass custom theme inside the sheet, but before we apply the theme inside the sheet,
we need to create theme inside `res/values/themes.xml` first
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<resources>
    <style name="WosBottomDialog" parent="BottomSheetDialogTheme">
        <item name="otpViewStyle">@style/OtpWidget.OtpView</item>
    </style>
</resources>
```

then we apply that theme inside a Sheet class below
```kotlin
class MySheet : ViewSheet<MySheetBinding, MySheetViewModel, State>(
    SheetVerifyOtpBinding::bind,
    R.layout.my_sheet
) {
	...
    override fun getTheme(): Int = R.style.WosBottomDialog
	...
}
```
